tuv.seg: • Safely disposing of waste • Further information
• Dramhaíl a dhiúscairt go sábháilte
It is illegal to burn household or garden waste at home or in your garden
Tá sé neamhdhleathach dramhaíl tí a dhó sa bhaile nó i do ghairdín féin
Burning waste can be a nuisance to neighbours and can also pollute the air by releasing harmful chemicals into it
Ní hamháin go gcuireann sé isteach ar do chomharsana nuair a dhéantar dramhaíl a dhó, ach is féidir leis ceimiceáin dhíobhálacha a scaoileadh san aer
There may be many toxic chemicals in waste items
Bíonn go leor ceimiceán tocsaineach i ndramhaíl
Paper waste may contain synthetic materials, preservatives and even plastics
Bíonn ábhair shintéiseacha, leasaithigh agus fiú amháin plaistigh le fáil i ndramhaíl pháipéir
Disposable nappies contain gels, bleaches and plastics
Bíonn glóthacha, tuarthóirí agus plaistigh le fáil i gclúidíní aon uaire
Many wood products are treated with toxic chemicals to prevent rot
Déantar mórán táirgí adhmaid a chóireáil le ceimiceáin thocsaineacha chun lobhadh a chosc
Burning of such wastes in low-temperature uncontrolled fires creates toxic and dangerous by-products which are not destroyed by the fire but become airborne on soot particles

Cruthaíonn dó dramhaíola den sórt sin i dtinte neamhrialaithe ísealteochta fotháirgí tocsaineacha agus díobhálacha, nach mbíonn tine in ann a scriosadh agus a bhíonn iompartha san aer ag cáithníní súiche
These can end up being inhaled or being washed out of the air and deposited onto surrounding soil and vegetation, where they can readily enter the food chain
Is féidir le duine iad seo a análú nó is féidir leo titim i bhfoirm báistí ón aer mar shil-leagan atá ábalta dul isteach sa bhiashlabhra go héasca
Burning household waste at home or in your garden is illegal
Tá sé neamhdhleathach dramhaíl tí a dhó sa bhaile nó i do ghairdín féin
Burning household waste can incur a fine of up to €3,000 or 12 months in prison upon summary conviction in a District Court
Seo a leanas samplaí de bhealaí nach féidir dramhaíl tí nó ghairdín a dhó:
• In a barrel or exposed pile in the yard or garden
• I mbairille nó carn oscailte sa chlós nó sa ghairdín
• On an open fire, range or other solid fuel appliance
• Ar thine oscailte, ar thinteog nó ar fhearas breosla sholadaigh
Waste burners and other devices such as mini or household incinerators, which may be located in buildings or gardens, are illegal even if they are attached to a stack or flue

Tá dóirí dramhaíola agus fearais eile cosúil le mion-loisceoirí nó loisceoirí tí, a d’fhéadfadh a bheith lonnaithe i bhfoirgnimh nó i ngairdíní, neamhdhleathach fiú amháin nuair a bhíonn siad ceangailte do shimléar nó múchán
Burning waste is an offence under waste management legislation and the Air Pollution Act 1987
Is cion atá ann dramhaíl a dhó faoin reachtaíocht um bainistíocht dramhaíola agus faoin Acht um Thruailliú Aeir, 1987
The Waste Management (Prohibition of Waste Disposal by Burning) Regulations 2009 strengthen the law against waste disposal by uncontrolled burning, which is also known as backyard burning
Treisíonn na Rialacháin um Bainistíocht Dramhaíola (cosc ar Dhiúscairt Dramhaíola trí Dhó) 2009 an dlí maidir le diúscairt dramhaíola trí dhó neamhrialaithe. Tugtar dó sa chlós cúil air freisin
Under Regulation 5, there is a limited exemption for the burning of uncontaminated waste generated by agricultural practices
Is féidir fíneáil suas le €3,000 a ghearradh as dramhaíl tí a dhó nó téarma príosúnachta 12 mhí a bheith i gceist ar chiontú achomair sa Chúirt Dúiche
Safely disposing of waste
Dramhaíl a dhiúscairt go sábháilte
Most areas have an organised domestic waste collection service
Tá seirbhís eagraithe bhailithe dramhaíl tí ann i bhformhór na gceantar

If you decide not to use an organised waste collection service, you can dispose of much of your own domestic waste by recycling and home composting. You can also use civic amenity centres or landfill sites
Má chinneann tú gan úsáid a bhaint as seirbhís eagraithe bailithe dramhaíola, féadfaidh tú go leor de do dhramhaíl féin tí a dhiúscairt trí athchúrsáil nó trí mhuiríniú baile
Your local authority can advise you on waste disposal and recycling facilities in your area
D'fhéadfá úsáid a bhaint freisin as ionaid chonláiste cathartha nó láithreáin líonta talún
Read more on the websites of the Department of Communication, Climate Action and the Environment and the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA)
Féadfaidh d’údarás áitiúil comhairle a thabhairt duit faoi dhiúscairt dramhaíola agus saoráidí athchúrsála i do cheantar
